Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • Server

  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    Server class that allows for clients to connect to the central server. Each new connection is started as a new thread via the nested class: MultipleServer. The Server class has data structures to store usernames and a reference to each client via the HashSet and ArrayList classes respectively.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  Server.MultipleServer
      Class that extends Thread class and contains methods to read from ,Clients handle message parsing and set usernames for Clients.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.util.ArrayList<Server.MultipleServer> clientList
      ArrayList of each client for use in message broadcasting
      private static long SERVER_START_TIME
      Long constant that stores the system time upon Server startup via the currentTimeMillis() method in the System class.
      private static java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> usrNameSet
      HashSet to to the usernames of each client; ensuring they are unique

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Server()
      Empty Constructor to create Server object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private static void broadcastMessage(java.lang.String MSG, Server.MultipleServer BCASTER)
      Method to cycle through online clients and broadcast messages.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method that throws IOException.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • usrNameSet

        private static java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> usrNameSet
        HashSet to to the usernames of each client; ensuring they are unique

      • clientList

        private static java.util.ArrayList<Server.MultipleServer> clientList
        ArrayList of each client for use in message broadcasting

      • SERVER_START_TIME

        private static final long SERVER_START_TIME
        Long constant that stores the system time upon Server startup via the currentTimeMillis() method in the System class. Used to calculate Server uptime.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server()
        Empty Constructor to create Server object. Only used to allow instantiation of Multiple Server inner class.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method that throws IOException. Method sets up a ServerSocket for new connections to the Server and upon new connections instantiates new MultipleServer threads and starts them.
        Parameters:
        args - - command line arguments passed to the Server on program start.

      • broadcastMessage

        private static void broadcastMessage(java.lang.String MSG,
                                     Server.MultipleServer BCASTER)
        Method to cycle through online clients and broadcast messages. The method iterates through the clientList and does not broadcast the message to the ClientInstance that was passed as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        MSG - - Message to be broadcast to other clients
        BCASTER - - The client that is sending the message (usually the client calling the method)
